description: From Scots hemmel, hammel, dialectal English hemble (“hovel, stable, shed”), perhaps allied to Dutch hemel (“heaven, canopy”), German Himmel. Compare English heaven.

entries.meaning: (UK, dialect, Northumbria) A shed or hovel for cattle.
examples: Cattle kept in hemmels should always have their food may be stated that the roofs of all the buildings should given to them in the sheds
